{{Infobox Education in Canada |name= '''St. Joseph High School''' |motto= ''''Once a Guardian, Always a Guardian'''' |streetaddress= 115 Nelson Road |city= [[Saskatoon]] |province= [[Saskatchewan]] |postalcode= S7S 1H1 |areacode= 306 |phone= 659-7650 |fax= 659-2173 |email= |url= http://blog.scs.sk.ca/st_joes/ |schoolnumber= |schoolboard= [[Greater Saskatoon Catholic School Division]] |principal= Rick Rowley |viceprincipal= Jackie Ackerman
Brandon Stroh |schooltype= [[High School]] |grades= 9-12 |language= [[Canadian English|English]], [[French Immersion]] |area= [[Saskatoon]] |mascot= Super Joe |teamname= Guardians |colours= Black, White, and Silver {{color box|black}}{{color box|white}}{{color box|silver}} |founded= 1995 |enrollment= ~1100}} The '''St. Joseph High School''' is a high school in [[Saskatoon]], [[Canada]], a part of the [[University Heights Suburban Centre, Saskatoon|University Heights Suburban Centre]]. St. Joseph's High School is part of the [[Greater Saskatoon Catholic School Division|Saskatoon Catholic School division]]. Opened in 1995, it currently has approximately 1000 students.{{cite web | last = | first = | authorlink = | coauthors = Mr. J.C. Schantale, Mrs. E. Joanah | title = St. Joseph High School | work = | publisher = | date = | url = http://blog.scs.sk.ca/stjoe/archives/assessment/ | format = | doi = | accessdate = 2008-05-19}} ==Notable alumni== *[[Colby Armstrong]], NHL forward for the [[Toronto Maple Leafs]] *[[Riley Armstrong (ice hockey)|Riley Armstrong]], forward for the [[Detroit Red Wings]] AHL affiliates, the [[Grand Rapids Griffins]] *[[Luke Schenn]], NHL defenceman for the [[Toronto Maple Leafs]] *[[Brayden Schenn]], NHL forward for the [[Philadelphia Flyers]], currently playing for the WHL's [[Saskatoon Blades]] *[[Jarret Stoll]], NHL forward for the [[Los Angeles Kings]] ==External links== * [http://blog.scs.sk.ca/st_joes/ Official website] * [http://ca.ratemyteachers.com/schools/saskatchewan/saskatoon/st_joseph_high_school/ Teacher Ratings] * [http://canaveral.scs.sk.ca/home.php/ Greater Saskatoon Catholic Schools Official] ==References== {{reflist|2}} {{coord missing|Saskatchewan}} {{Saskatoon High Schools}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Saint Joseph High School (Saskatoon)}} [[Category:High schools in Saskatoon]] [[Category:Roman Catholic secondary schools in Saskatchewan]] [[Category:Educational institutions established in 1995]] {{Saskatchewan-school-stub}}
